inn1.comm: strides down the pitch and defends that down to the covers - an early sign of intent, and it's matched by a whipped-in throw back to the sticks
left alone outside off, some good shape there
another decent dot, this time the ball hits the seam just outside off and nips back in past the hip at a tight angle
down the channel again, quite a bit wider, and that swings gently away, Bell shoulders arms early
more swing in the air and Bell lets that one sail on its contented way through to Boucher
down the track again, that one outside off once more and that's tucked into the covers, gently, on the back foot, the off-side fielders swooping in as one
gets good lift off that one, shaping away from the righthander, pitched right up there and picking up the pace on its way through
left alone, on the backfoot, outside off
left alone again outside off, Langeveldt's hit the spot there, and he knows it, too, his "Ooh" showing he was hoping for more than a leave from that ball
Vaughan was tempted to play at that one but pulled out of the shot at the last minute
down the off-side channel once more
left alone again, once more down the channel
a hint of swing again and that's left alone - and yes, it's in the corridor again
yes - Bell and England are finally off the mark, that one a touch short down off, allowing Bell to open his shoulders and dink a back-foot cut through point
pushed right up there and Vaughan defends that on the front foot into the covers
straight and on the back foot poking that square to point
another tidy delivery, this one full, and it's just left alone outside off stump once more
a play and a miss, well, a jab and a miss really, Vaughan fishing at that one outside his off stump
strays on leg and that's immediately leapt upon by Bell who comes down the pitch and works that off his legs, with a flick through midwicket, nicely timed
nice, tight and straight and that's defended on the front foot
left alone outside off, another one slinking down the hallway
Bell down the pitch again, but Langeveldt followed him this time, and he can only defend that into the covers
a touch towards the batsman, and Bell locates the middle of the bat with a firm drive to cover
how was that not out? Half an appeal for one which sounded like he'd got an inside edge, but in fact that just touched the off stump on the way through to the keeper. Great ball
left alone outside off
pushed up there and that's just defended forward
again, that's up there on off, and Vaughan tries to drive that through the covers, but picks out the fielder, rather than the gap
oh, super delivery! That one just jumps back off the seam, squaring Vaughan up, and his is a play and a miss that he has the decency to smile about afterwards; he knows he was beaten there
that one kept low-ish on its way through, again down off
outside off and that's left alone on the back foot
ah, on middle-and-leg and Bell's to the pitch of the ball once more, striking that cleanly on the front foot in front of midwicket
outside off and that's played down into the covers off the back foot
outside off, did you guess, and that's left alone - plenty of swing for the bowlers this morning
South Africa thought they had a wicket at last, then, Bell chasing that away from his body, wide, and he was dragged out there
down the channel and, again, it's just left
straight lines again, this one on off stump, and it's just defended on the back foot
pushed up there again, on the dime, and Vaughan defends forward
more defence, this time on the back foot, and again the ball is just in too good a place to get away
on the back foot and that's played down into the covers
outside off and that's driven out through the covers. Rapturous applause greets the two, as if that was England's hundred
straight as a die, and Vaughan tries to work over it, to push it into midwicket. His timing's awry, though
defended back to the bowler
outside off and that's another play and miss from Bell, trying to drive through the air
outside off, shape away, and Bell leaves that

and he's gone! That's banged in wide of the off stump, Bell goes for the pull, doesn't get over it at all, and skies it to Prince at midwicket who combats the sun in taking a good catch, low, on the crouch
outside off and there's room for Vaughan to drive through the covers
gest away with that one, top-edged pull right over the slips - not at all where he intended it to go
tucked off his hips behind square and, oh dear, Prince nearly runs out Strauss before he's had chance to face a delivery - he got back in his crease, though
on leg - Pollock failing to adjust enough for the lefthander - and Strauss is off the mark straight away
outside off this time, and that just dies on its way through to the keeper, Strauss leaving it alone
on off and that's poked down to third man
on middle and that's the first extra of the innings, an overstep there from Pollock
oh, a very good shout, but Umpire Bucknor's unmoved. That hit just outside off, was pad then bat, and that would just have gone over the off-bail. Testing delivery at 80mph (128.8kph)
driven into short midwicket and the best option is to "Wait!"
driven forward into the covers
on middle, and there's a quick single squeezed out in front of midwicket
short, outside off, and that's smashed in front of square
outside off and that nips back in, on a good length, to Vaughan who defends without fuss. Fussless defence
on leg, flicked away, hit on top of the bounce and that fair rockets across the outfield in front of midwicket
short, and that's careering on towards Vaughan's chest before he defends it down, straight
on leg, Vaughan tries to swivel that through square, fails to connect and ends up doing a dainty pirouette to make Billy Elliott proud
wide of Strauss's off stump and he steps forward, shouldering arms like a good'un
excellent line and length, just drawing Strauss forward and inviting him to drive. Strauss declines and defends
a touch of width, feeding Strauss's penchant for the cut...and he does cut, but hammers it to point
Strauss goes for an expansive drive but the bat twists in his hand and it flies to Nel and mid-off
pushed out to cover
calmly, elegantly driven out to cover to prevent the maiden and to steal the strike
wider of the wicket, and wider of Strauss's stumps who comes forward cautiously before leaving it well alone
what a magnificent shot. That's Strauss at his best - the Strauss of 18 months ago. It wasn't that short but he was quickly back, pulling it well in front of square for six

ooh and he steps down the pitch ala Bell Mach II, misreads an off-cutter which appeared initially to balloon off his pads - the ball falling just short of the slips - but in fact he got an edge on that. Fell safe, either way
beautifully driven straight to cover
short of a length, Vaughan is up on his toes like a ballerina on acid, punching it into the covers and they race through for a single
excellent delivery swinging into off stump, but very well played by Strauss who digs it out with impressive cleanliness and timing
here comes the rhino, up to the crease and it's just short of a length, rising onto Vaughan who pushes it off the back foot

angling into Vaughan who falls away a touch to the off side. It raps him on the pads and Nel roars a typically lively appeal, performing a mini starjump-appeal for Steve Bucknor who, after a long pause, raises his finger
defended off the back foot. Pietersen screams no
a cracking delivery! Just short of a length, but only just, and it fairly pinged off the pitch - tennis ball bounce - causing Pietersen to leap dramatically out of the way
another bouncer which Pietersen tries to pull, but he gets a bottom edge to cover
full, angling into his pads - and in fact it hits his pad, causing Nel to roar a hopeful, vain appeal but it was miles down the leg side
just a touch too short and Strauss angles it past the slips down to third man. A nice, deft piece of play there
Pietersen is forward massively, crashing it back to Hall
too straight - don't bowl there to Pietersen - and the batsman works it off middle-and-off through square leg for a single
Strauss is back into his crease and, with a pleasingly high front elbow, punch-defends it back to the bowler
punched with greater intent, square to point. But straight to point and there's no run there
yes, just again a little too short from Hall, but a good line and it's pushed back to the bowler to end the over
fended off his chest, quite expertly, down to a short fine leg
ineffectual delivery, short and wide of the off stump and Strauss is calmly pushing this out into the covers
oh, that's Strauss's absolute bread and butter. Far too short and wide, and Strauss crashes it behind square off the back foot. Hit with immense power, placed excellently
and an expansive cover drive on the front foot this time, squirting it square down to third man
defended on the front foot
good comeback from Nel. It's always great watching him bowl - like a rhino on rollerskates, he really races up to the crease. This is on off stump and defended
oh, fabulous shot. This is Strauss of 2004, picking up the length remarkably quickly. It was too short, granted - but only by an inch or two - and pulled with power and timing through midwicket
and he adjusts his length, but it's still a fraction too short and he guides it down to third man
defended off the back foot to cover
excellent length this time. Pietersen isn't sure whether to come forward or back - he does come forward, as he loves to do, but can't make anything of it. Just defends back to the bowler
again, very well bowled, Pietersen blocks it out to leg
no, no, no. Sloppiness. A leg-side drifter which Pietersen easily, naturally just flicks for a single
turned his hip to midwicket. Strauss wants a run, Pietersen doesn't, and he has to scamper back in his crease
squared up a touch trying to whip it to leg, it's spooned to Graeme Smith at mid-off - and he's not going to drop that - who dives forward a metre to take a fine, low catch
defended on the front foot. Excellent ball on off stump
that is quick, a bouncer (but too wide) and left alone...but that fairly shot off the pitch
well, he's squared up here, squirting it down to third man...though he did play it late and he was in reasonable control of it
lovely straight drive down the ground, albeit without timing
and a good length, if a little too wide, Collingwood inside-edging it into his pads
too wide, left alone
much better length and Collingwood comes forward, tentatively so, defending it on the front foot - though his left hand jags off the bat
a huge appeal from Boucher behind the stumps who thought Collingwood edged it, but the ball - an excellent incutter - brushed his pad
Collingwood skips down the pitch, as most England batsmen seem to do, before blocking it
no skipping this time but it's defended on the front foot
good one just outside off, Strauss comes forward to block it out
another good one, a touch shorter and an inch wider of the off stump; Strauss leaves alone

ooh crashed in the air, just short of Gibbs at backward point who fields and glares at the batsman as if to say "what are you trying, mate? It's me at backward point and I don't drop a lot." He's right too
punched off the back foot
beaten with a ripsnorting crackerjack. The perfect length, Strauss fishes outside off and misses it but, with the angle Nel is creating around the wicket, that was mighty close
firmly punched to mid-off, but it's a no-ball from Nel
fended over second slip! What a belting delivery from Nel, angling into Collingwood's neck and he fends it, edging it over second slip - but only just - down to third man
Strauss is forward to defend
ah, clever clever bowling but Strauss is wise to the cunning ploy of Hall pushing this across him. A calm piece of arm-shouldering yields no run
neatly played, Strauss back into his crease and turning it to leg with a flick of the wrists
very good length again, and Collingwood is looking decidedly unsure out there. A reasonably solid forward defence but without really getting to the pitch
oh but he looks more sure of himself now, with a delicious and aggressive flick to leg, timing it well - oh but a fine save from Kallis, diving to his right at mid-on, prevents more than a single
firmly blocked out on off stump
on leg, a touch short, and Collingwood thinks of working that into short midwicket, he does so, but he doesn't time it
naggles that one back in at the righthander from outside off and it jags back at him, awkward. Don't think naggles is a word but you know what I mean
left alone outside off
left alone outside off and that's wide
defended forward without too much fuss
right up there and timed with a pleasing "Thlock" through cover, played off the back foot
more attempted naggling, but Nel strays on to leg stump, rather the ball does, and that's dinked into short midwicket and he's stolen the strike
that one pitches on off and moves towards middle as Collingwood gets over it, working it to short midwicket
rushes that one on to middle and that's defended tidily into the short midwicket region
huge amounts of lift! Great delivery, that one climbing to the top floor, climbing way above Collingwood, but not before threatening to kiss his helmet - Boucher does well to save the byes, there
pushed into short midwicket
slower ball, pushed right up there, Collingwood picks it, defends, and then smiles
defended down into the gully
on leg, a good line to a righthander it must be said but there's a flaw in that, and that's helped with some good wristing to square
expecting the bouncer, stops on the shot, but forgets to move his gloves out of the way and the ball crashes into his hands
and this time the ball does bounce, but Strauss wasn't expecting, and the ball flies up off the shoulder of the bat, Strauss trying to sway away from the shot, and into space at third man
defended forward
outside off and that's skewed off the edge into short midwicket and the batsmen run through an almost apologetic single
outside off and Strauss slams down his hands into that one, a firm cut through cover
on leg to begin with, up there, but that's worked into short midwicket
short, and that's driven to long-on for a quick single
round the wicket, tries to pull that and he tries to pull, the ball goes over the outside edge and Boucher, standing up, can't get near it
cut away to just inside the point boundary
too wide down the off and that's left alone
left alone again outside off
turned round to Pollock down at deep fine leg
right up there and that's defended into short midwicket
down leg and that's turned round to fine leg again
defended this time
on off and that's poked down to gully and they're both firm in deciding that "No!" now is not the time to go for a run
a cheeky single this time
gets his glove on that one as he tries to pull it
right up there, but driven out to long-on for an easy single
outside off and that's easily driven through cover
up there on off, but it's taken almost literally off his toes to drive to mid-on
a good line to the lefthander, but too full, and that's driven out to long-off
defended forward
on off and that's turned round the corner, well, there isn't a corner, but anyway, behind square
driven down, without power, to gully
outside off, cuts in at an awkward height, but that's well defended down
right up there and that's driven straight to long-off
floats that in, nearly a full toss, and Collingwood keeps that out with a dig off the bat into his pads
oh, got away with that one, Kallis sending that one in at a testing angle, cutting back into him, and a leading edge goes abegging through gully
driven straight to cover who  makes no mistake
driven to extra cover and that's picked up snappily as a sharp-suited dresser
driven out to extra cover and they think of taking the second, but decide against it
a lot of effort for a ball that's a decent pitch, on off, but defended easily enough
driven to long-off
outside off and Collingwood looks to nudge that down to gully, but he's cramped for room
sweet shot, nice one. That's on middle-and-leg and just timed in front of square with a neat flick of the wrists
outside off and that's played straight down to gully
on middle-and-leg and that's driven to mid-on
oh, slower ball, deceptive as you like, and Strauss doesn't like, cutting right under it - the ball kept low, too
on middle, great length, and that's just defended forward
defended forward
outside off and that's cut off the back foot, nearly timed, and they get the single
short and that's pulled firmly in front of square to bring up the 50 partnership from 78 balls
defended into the covers
outside off, a hint of turn away, and that's nearly chopped back onto the stumps
slower ball, misdirected and easily picked, but the timing wasn't there, the ball just driven without much power to mid-on
outside off and again that's not timed again, just dabbed into the off-side
a touch slower, a touch short and that's whipped up through midwicket
punched off the back foot without much timing
just a touch shorter and punched straight to point
blimey that was a bit close. Strauss walked across his stumps, quite considerably, tried to flick it to leg but missed and very nearly lost his leg stump
excellent length, Strauss is slightly unsure whether to go forward or back. Driven back to the bowler
crashed on the front foot, opening the face of the bat quite nicely to send it out into the deep, square
short, rising onto Collingwood who defends defends it while airborne. He initially wanted a single but Kallis lumbered to his right to field, preventing a single
and it's full, straight and defended by Strauss
cracked down to third man
dabbed off the back foot down to third man
nudged off his legs but he can't break the gap
pushed through cover for a quick single
and it's pushed down to mid-on for another cheeky single
a flourishing defensive prod to short mid-off
that's a fine, shock bouncer from Kallis, taking Collingwood by surprise - surprisingly so - who ducks beneath it at the last moment
too straight, allowing Collingwood to nurdle it to leg for a singleton
and Nelson's done it for South Africa! Excellent field placing from Smith plonking himself at a fourth slip and Strauss cuts it straight to him
banged on the front foot to mid-off
just short of a length, Flintoff goes back and across, punching it just wide of a short mid-off and they run through for a single to get him off the mark
pushed out into the covers
neatly guided down to third man
very well bowled and the first sign, I think, of reverse swing as this one bends into the batsman. But it's firmly dug out and they sprint through for a very well-run single
cut, or rather sliced, square of the wicket
goddim! Swinging into Collingwood again who is rapped quite high on the pads, and Taufel raises his finger. That would've clipped middle-and-off
left alone outside off
well bowled! Though it's wided by Bucknor. A fast bouncer and an unfriendly greeting to Flintoff who ducks underneath
dabbed down to third man
calmly played off the back foot down to fine leg
good length, Nel, spearing into Flintoff's legs - the batsman takes a step to leg, in fact, defending it with no great conviction
much better from Flintoff, solidly blocking it out - his bat looming down on the ball like an old barn door
just paddled, nothing more, to deep square leg. Such is Flintoff's natural timing that it speeds along the outfield rather zippily
left alone outside off, too wide - and Nel is absolutely disgusted with himself, and with the world in general
what a ball! That's a cracker from Hall, just outside off and cutting back quite markedly into Flintoff who tries to drive on the up and is bowled through the gate, the middle stump flattened
clipped to leg. The wrong line there from Hall
hmm, Bopara walks across his stumps here - plays it well enough, to leg, but exposes his leg stump
confidently forward from Bopara, just defending it on the front foot
clunked out into the covers
gone! And another one! My word Hall has been outstanding today; wicket to wicket, just slanting it across Nixon who nibbled at it without conviction and edged it to Boucher
defended out to cover: Bopara roars no
too wide of the off stump, left alone by Bopara
shuffles across his stumps, gets himself in line and defends it under his nose off the back foot
shorter from Nel, on a good line too angling into the batsman who defends off the back foot
too wide, too short and Bopara is disinterested
and a tighter line causes Bopara to defend on the front foot
and another one for Hall! They just cannot pick up his length today. A beautiful little inswinger to Mahmood who didn't come forward sufficiently, an inside edge knocking over his middle stump
and Panesar plays and misses outside off! Very, very close
another play-and-miss, albeit too wide to really be bothering with. But England are under the spell here and, well, they don't know what's going on
again more massive swing past Monty who this time leaves alone
angled down to third man
ooh close, he's rapped on the pads - Boucher roars, but it's not even an appeal. Just a "raww-ahh" in vain
and he plays and misses again outside off
ooh plays and misses again. This is a terrific line from around the wicket
edged, and it falls short of Boucher. Very short of Boucher, in fact. A fine delivery, Panesar absolutely clueless
but it's elegantly left alone outside off this time
a good bouncer but it's well played, just swaying out of the way
left alone outside off
too wide and rightly called a wide
ironic, cruel cheers resonate around the ground as he finally gets willow onto leather, punching it nowhere for a zero
neat stroke. Excellent, in fact, driving on the up and lofting it just wide of mid-off
punch-defended on the back foot to cover
beautifully driven straight, but too straight - and it canons into the non-striker's stumps. Damn them and their blocking ways
intelligent cricket from a bold young player, flicking this wayward delivery down to fine leg for four
square driven on the front foot for a couple
well bowled. Bopara can't get this away and defends back to the bowler
on leg, and Panesar waits patiently before driving it cleanly in front of midwicket
outside off and he just opens his shoulders, not literally, to caress that one down to third man
tucks Panesar up with a straight one, on off, that's dealt with courtesy of a prod down off the back foot
Pollock races in, plants that one on a good length and it's defended down
outside off and that's fended down, again. There's a pattern
straight, and defended down, again on the back foot
big outside edge and that just eludes the tumbling Boucher outside his right hand, at full stretch. Excellent stretching, and good bowling, but nothing doing
driven straight, so straight it knocks the stumps at the bowler's end, and they run while the ricochet is gathered
Panesar proving, lest there be any doubt, which there wasn't, that he can play a lovely, shiny back-foot defensive shot
defended again
shapes to drive off the back foot to the covers, but stops on the shot, and the ball, although out of the middle, goes gently to the fielder
effort all round there - effort from the bowler, looking for the bouncer, and Panesar made a good effort of flaying that off the back foot, apart from the fact that he missed it completely
on leg, that sits up and asks Bopara if he wouldn't mind terribly swishing that off his legs to square. And he didn't, so he did
stands tall, and his feet are trapped in driving that to cover
pushed right onto the back foot and Panesar cradles his bat to push the ball to cover
driven to cover
swishes outside off, feet going nowhere, bat going everywhere but towards the ball, and that leaps over the outside edge
poked again at that one and again it jumps over his outside edge - or, you could argue he played under it
defended on the back foot
outside off and that's dabbled down to gully
defended on the back foot
poked his bat away from his body and got a single for his trouble as he ran that one down to third man
short, wide, but he misses out in driving that straight to the covers
slash outside off
good work from Nel, a bouncer
on leg and that's tucked off the legs, literally, behind square
a wide one down the corridor, possibly deliberate, and Panesar slashes away from his body, backing away, and a loud snick booms out as Boucher takes that tidily
pushed up there and that's defended
cuts back in off the seam and Anderson contrives to miss that, and it just fails to hit the stumps
outside off and that's left alone
driven into the covers
cuts in off the seam, there's nothing you can do with that apart from defend it forward
outside off and Boucher does well to snap that up, standing up to that one, and it's too quick for Bopara, who's not even onto the shot before the ball's through
slower ball, and that's well dug out
rushes that wristily through midwicket
that nearly ended the innings and Anderson knows it, smiling as that cuts away from him, squaring him up on the front foot, horrible attempt at a shot
chased down leg
outside off and that's poked down through gully off the back foot
driven out to cover
pushed right up there and that's driven to long-off
pitches on middle, turns down leg and that's swished away off the pad. Top padding
short, wide and that's c-r-ashed off the back foot through cover, his front foot lifting off the ground with the effort
does very well to tuck that yorker off his toes through midwicket
on leg, stands tall, and drives that one to mid-on
driven to point, that's snapped up zestily and returned to the keeper
driven to the covers
on a good length, but Hall just snatches at that one and, though he took the pace off, they get the single
that one shapes away from Anderson, lovely shape, Monroe-esque curvature there, and Anderson's naturally tempted. He gets away with the swish
very very straight, as out as you like that one and that's a very well deserved five-for. That one hit him low, and full, and Anderson stood there bewildered, awaiting the inevitable finger of fate

inn2.comm: and it's short and wide, de Villiers clatters it through the vacant gully and down to third man
ooh a good one from Anderson, albeit too straight and swinging into him, but it almost cuts him in half and Smith, the left-hander, is struck on the thigh
booming inswing to Smith for the first time, angling toward first slip before swinging into the batsman who defends with a straight bat off the back foot
a play and a miss outside off, a wayward delivery really that deserved to be boshed. Fell short of Nixon...
nicely played by Smith, whipping it strongly through midwicket
on leg stump and defended by Anderson
driven firmly to Vaughan at mid-off who dives, fumbles, parries and allows them through for a three
no no, too straight and Smith works it off his legs
almost beaten by the pace there, clamping down on it and getting a very thick inside edge down to fine leg
hammered! Superb shot, dispatching a terrible delivery. Short, wide and laced with immense power square of the wicket
much, much better delivery on off stump with just a hint of outswing, forcing de Villiers to defend
good grief that's a remarkable shot. A short-arm pull to one which really wasn't that short, and it absolutely races across the outfield for four
a huge appeal from Anderson as Smith is rapped on t'pads, but it pitched outside leg
and again, it's outside leg and Smith just plonks it through midwicket with the minimum of fuss
at last, that's where to bowl. Outside off and it hits a crack, or something, and fairly pings off the pitch, beating Smith's wary waft
much better from Anderson, again on off stump and swinging into Smith - but he actually plays it extremely well, driving it on the up with a closed face, sending it just past mid-on for a couple
outside leg now - Anderson's doing well to bowl this wide - and clipped down to a squareish fine leg
wide of the off stump, swinging wider still and wided by Steve Bucknor
beautifully cover driven but straight to the fielder
Smith skips down the pitch and laces Mahmood to cover, who gets half a stinging hand on it to prevent four, but he really hammered that
just a touch fuller and de Villiers plays and misses
short and wide, de Villiers deliberately flashes and slashes, hard, over Flintoff at first slip
magnificent shot - such quick hands from de Villiers, and so quick to pick up the length. He just picked it up off a length, pulling it over long-on for a short-armed four
drifting down leg, de Villiers just gets bat on it to grab a single to leg
ah, the famous Mahmood slower ball - milk float slow - but predictably it's drifting down the leg side and, well, it's just turned through midwicket
a fine delivery from Anderson this time, on off stump and just shaping away. de Villiers blocks it out with caution
again, nicely bowled. Full, straight, defended on the front foot
just loses his line a touch here, too straight and de Villiers flicks it through de midwicket
remarkably wide of the off stump. Just not controlling the swing here, and he's too wary of pitching it up to de Villiers
that's a better line, just in the corridor and de Villiers is watchful in his arm-shouldering

ah, just a brilliant shot here. A slap through cover - what an eye de Villiers has. Hardly any foot movement - perhaps he was going to pull it, then changed his mind and slapped it audaciously through cover
a huge appeal to Anderson's first crackerjack of the innings, a beautiful outswinger to de Villiers who was beaten all ends up. Anderson and all of England appeal but Bucknor shakes his head
full, on off stump, and Smith just swings through the line and sends it for four. DIsmissive
neatly late cut down to third man
a dot ball! It's left alone outside off
ooh, it cuts back hard on de Villiers who played it rather poorly, too late on it, and it races down for four byes
defended on the back foot. Better length
on leg stump, turned to leg for a zero
swinging into the batsman who turns it around the corner
oh, poor ball on leg stump and Smith dances down the pitch, clipping it down to fine leg. Mahmood does very well to run to his left and prevent four
fabulous shot. Another slap, this time on the front foot. The audacity, and class, was quite breathtaking there. He's unleashing his shots from the locker now
better one on middle stump from Anderson which is blocked out
well they're going for it now. Smith charges Mahmood, who only has cash on him, and it's spliced down to third man
a fine ball with which to end the over, on off stump, but de Villiers is up to the mark, defending it with a straight bat on the front foot
and he practically runs down the pitch at Flintoff, trying to smash it over his head but he gets a thick outside edge down to third man
too wide, and wided
an ugly smite by Smith who misreads the length, and clunks it to cover
and he gets a touch of inswing, Flintoff, forcing de Villiers to defend
again a good length here, if not the perfect line - on middle-and-leg - which de Villiers blocks out. Such is his innate timing, it tempts Smith to take a single but de Villiers turns it down
a textbook cover drive to Panesar which bounces a foot before him at mid-off and the spin of the ball almost foxes him
defended off the back foot but...it's a no-ball
this hurries de Villiers who almost takes a step to leg to defend
quick, flat, and defended by Smith
swept powerfully, disdainfully down to fine leg for four
oh and he gets away with it! A step down the pitch and Smith attempts to sweep but top-edges it over the wicketkeeper's head
just too short, de Villiers is so quick on his feet, rocking back and cutting it firmly behind point for four. Terrific, classy stroke
played back to the bowler
shoulders arms outside off
flicked through midwicket for a single
magnificent. de Villiers is in quite brilliant touch at the moment. The most textbook of cover drives. Nothing more need be said, really
and he's back into his crease, timing it nicely out into the covers but not placing it this time
a full toss which he can't time, bunging it to mid-off
a cracking delivery, bit short but it didn't climb as much as de Villiers expected. A thin edge to an attempted cut handed Nixon a simple chance
short, Kallis times it to leg
on the money, pushing Smith onto his back foot for a solid defence
on middle and that's wristed through midwicket for a quick two
waits, waits and then he's off, with a lovely back foot drive rocking back and cutting away. Have some
down the wicket and that's a very straight aerial drive. Bludgeoned
a big stride down for this one and he plants his front foot out towards leg in order to drive through the line to long-on

outside off and that's run down to third man where, oh dear, Mahmood makes a hash out of that one, putting his hand over the ball and just escorting it to the boundary. "He's got 6 ft 8 or whatever to go down, and at least made 6 ft 7 of it," notes Martin, glass half-full (of ICC-approved product)
on leg and that's tucked bluntly behind square
up there, defended down straight and "That's brilliant!" exaggerates Nixon
on leg and that's timed very well indeed through the gap wide of long-on. Help yourself
on off, rising, and that's tucked back down into the covers
outside off and that's poked down into short cover
outside off again and an inside edge isn't nearly chopped on
on middle and that's worked out to the midwicket boundary where the sweeper accords with his job description
outside off, bounce, and that's just rocked into the covers off the back foot
right up there, on off, and that's driven into the covers with Kallis's instruction to "Wait!" Good thinking, that was straight to the fielder (and not fiddler as I just mistyped)
that would have been an unusual way to get out indeed! Kallis charged Flintoff, who picked that up and bowled a bouncer, Kallis falling into it and getting castled by the force of the inside edge
recovers with a quick single this time
outside off, pulled round behind wicket and that's a single to give him the strike as he hovers near fifty

on off and worked into the on-side and that indeed is Smith's half-cenutry, just nine dot balls, in the 34 deliveries with five fours, a strike rate of 147.5 and that took less than an hour and that's top statting from myself
dully driven with grey intent back to the bowler
this one was better, capitalised on the sniff of width and drove that out for a quick single
up there, on off, and that's poked down into the covers. "Good Colly, come on boys," says Nixon
backs away to smite that one from middle through cover
hit out through midwicket
backs way away from the sticks, Flintoff follows him, but the batsman just drives it out to long-off
yorker length, outside off, and Smith bludgeons that into the ground
outside off and that's pirouetted round behind square like an elephant in a tutu - a very effective elephant, all the same
takes a step down, checks the step, and then leans into a crisp cover drive that picks out the fielder
outside off and that nips back in off the seam, bouncing up a touch, and it's defended down
outside off and that's chased on the back foot, but he cuts over the ball
round the wicket and that's a lesser-spotted dot from Mahmood, the batsman forced to defend on the front foot
short and that's a magnificent strike! Down the pitch and that's hoisted away over midwicket. Take that. And party
straight, Smith tries to pull it, misses, gets hit, but shrugs it off like the invincible winner he is today
gets hold of it this time, but still not cleanly, that one pulled to midwicket
right up there and Kallis stands firm to drive that to the man at cover
driven forward, back to the bowler
shot of the day. There wasn't too much wrong with that ball, but Smith just leant into it, and drove right through over a ducking Kallis and away through mid-on. Shot!
on off and this time it's driven to the other side of the sticks, past Flintoff, and that's away through mid-off this time - Smith giving that the full force. Good stuff
outside off and that's just laughably good - Smith over the top and that's wide of Anderson, South Africa closing in on the rout
very wide, and Smith got bat on that else it would have been called, I suspect, the ball bouncing down in front of Nixon
short and that's pulled out on the bounce to Bell on the midwicket boundary
nipping back in from off and that's driven out to mid-off
outside off and poked down to third man
top-edged a pull, Nixon takes, celebrates, and that's a no-ball. Nixon could have run him out if he wasn't busy over-celebrating like a big winner
short and that's smashed through midwicket. Smashed, I tell you
outside off and that's driven through cover
bouncer attempt - at 87mph (140kph) - and the batsman backs away from it, trying to hoick it out of the ground
flamingo-whipped in front of midwicket, very Pietersen-esque, and we like that - a good, clean strike
worked outside off and he's pinched the strike, the rum'un
stays over and that's worked down off the back foot to third man
on leg and that's driven straight to the man just back at mid-on, not quite long-on, three-quarters on if you like
tucked off the hips to square
outside off and Smith takes the pace off his shot, going for a big carve, but cutting down on it, softly, in the end
outside off and that's driven over midwicket. Great shot
driven to the covers
on off and that's driven in front of midwicket and they come back for three to bring up the 9000th ODI run - and this will be one of his most satisfying victories
down the ground and that's that - Smith making short work of the win
